Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Trustworthy \Trust"wor`thy\, a. Worthy of trust or confidence; trusty. -- {Trust"wor`thi*ness}, n. [1913 Webster]

trustworthy adj 1: worthy of trust or belief; "a trustworthy report"; "an experienced and trustworthy traveling companion" [syn: {trusty}] [ant: {untrustworthy}] 2: taking responsibility for one's conduct and obligations; "trustworthy public servants"
